meanings.definition: A deep, narrow hole made in the ground, especially to locate water or oil.
meanings.sent1: The miners dug a borehole to find clean water for the village.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the borehole to understand the underground layers.
meanings.sent3: The borehole in the backyard turned out to be a hidden treasure chest!
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity was a borehole into the mysteries of the earth.
meanings.sent5: The borehole was a dark tunnel leading into the unknown depths.

meanings.sent4: His questions borehole into the heart of the matter, revealing the truth.
